title:
On the lower bounds of $p$-modulus of families of paths and a finite
  connectedness
authors: Evgeny Sevost'yanov, Zarina Kovba, Heorhii Nosal
abstract:
We study the problem of the lower bounds of the modulus of families of paths
of order $p,$ $p>n-1,$ and their connection with the geometry of domains
containing the specified families. Among other things, we have proved an
analogue of N\"akki's theorem on the positivity of the $p$-module of families
of paths joining a pair of continua in the given domain. The geometry of
domains with a strongly accessible boundary in the sense of the $p$-modulus of
families of paths was also studied. We show that domains with a $p$-strongly
accessible boundary with respect to a $p$-modulus, $p>n-1,$ are are finitely
connected at their boundary. The mentioned result generalizes N\"akki's result,
which was proved for uniform domains in the case of a conformal modulus.
